intro: Beilschmiedia leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found on the island of Leyte. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and elliptic in shape, with a smooth margin and a glossy green upper surface. Beilschmiedia leytensis produces small, clustered flowers followed by spherical, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife.
